answerText: Samuel Taylor Coleridge[10] This group of poems including "This Lime Tree Bower," "My Prison", and ""Dejection: an Ode"" was written between 1795 and 1796 and is considered by many critics to be Coleridge's finest work.
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Alabama + Georgia Tech+ WUStL | 17 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This man coined the term "suspension of disbelief" in his major prose work, the Biografia Literaria.  For 10 points each, answer some questions about him. [10] Name this English poet of "Rime of the Ancient Mariner" who also hatched a failed plan to build a utopian commune called Pantisocracy with Robert Southey.
